alert.note: Alert for East Glacier Park Region; Elkhorn and Boulder Mountains; Northwest Beaverhead County; Southern Rocky Mountain Front; Upper Blackfoot and MacDonald Pass (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 04 at 11:49AM MST until March 06 at 5:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 6 inches. Isolated totals approaching 8 inches above pass level. * WHERE...The Continental Divide along the Rocky Mountain Front, Upper Blackfoot and MacDonald Pass, Elkhorn and Boulder Mountains, and Northwest Beaverhead County. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 5 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow may be intermittent at times, especially across Southwest Montana tonight.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.

area.areaDesc: East Glacier Park Region; Elkhorn and Boulder Mountains; Northwest Beaverhead County; Southern Rocky Mountain Front; Upper Blackfoot and MacDonald Pass
